titleStmt.title: A new dialogue between Dick of Kent, and Wat the Welch-man. Filled up with many pretty conceits, written and printed on purpose to make folks merry in time of sadnesse. / By Laurence Price. This new conceited book will move delights, and serve to passe away some dolesome dayes, also the tedious melancholy nights, for in the same is many a pretty phrase. No harm at all is in't but mirth and joy, then buy it first, then bear't with you away.
titleStmt.author: L. P. (Laurence Price), fl. 1625-1680?

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for John Andrews at the White Lyon in the Old-Baily.,

notesStmt.note: Verso of first leaf bears woodcut illustration.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the White Lyon in the Old-Baily.
